activities: We are a SaaS provider and license our platform to international companies, many with European operations.  Their employees may donate from their European location, or donate to a European non-profit organization.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
privacyprograms: We are certified and reviewed by eTrust for US-EU and US-Swiss compliance.
recoursemech:
Any questions or concerns regarding the use or disclosure of personal information should be directed to the YourCause Privacy Office at the address given below. YourCause will investigate and attempt to resolve complaints and disputes regarding use and disclosure of personal information by reference to the principles contained in this Policy. For complaints that cannot be resolved between YourCause and the complainant, YourCause has agreed to participate in third-party dispute and mediation procedures in the investigation and resolution of complaints to resolve disputes pursuant to the Safe Harbor Principles: 

•	For disputes involving all personal information received by YourCause from Switzerland, YourCause has agreed and to cooperate with the Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC); 

•	For disputes involving employment-related personal information received by YourCause from the EEA, YourCause has agreed to cooperate with the data protection authorities in the EEA and to participate in the dispute resolution procedures of the panel established by the European data protection authorities; 

•	For disputes involving all other personal information received by YourCause from the EEA, YourCause has agreed to eTrust dispute resolution. Individuals who submit a question or concern to YourCause and who do not receive acknowledgment from YourCause of the inquiry or who think their question or concern has not been satisfactorily addressed should then contact the eTrust Safe Harbor Dispute Resolution Program on the Internet or by mail. Inquiries by mail should identify YourCause as the company to which a concern or question has been submitted, and include a description of the privacy concern, the name of the individual submitting the inquiry, and whether eTrust may share the details of the inquiry with YourCause. eTrust will act as a liaison to YourCause to resolve these disputes. 

a. Online at: http://www.etrust.org/complaint/raise_privacy_complaint.php 

b. Mail: 

EU and Worldwide 
eTrust 
Communications House 
26 York Street 
London 
W1U 6PZ 

US 
eTrust 
616 Corporate Way 
Suite 2 #4000 
Valley Cottage 
NY 10989 

For information about eTrust or the operation of eTrust's dispute resolution process, visit eTrust on the Internet (www.etrust.org) or request this information from eTrust by mail using the contact information listed above. The eTrust dispute resolution process shall be conducted in English.
